title: Co-electrolysis SOEC and internal reforming SOFC for achieving a carbon-neutral society
content:
RSC Sustain., 2024, 2,1568-1579
DOI: 10.1039/D4SU00095A, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Hirofumi Sumi
Co-electrolysis SOECs can convert steam + CO2 to fuels and raw materials via syngas (H2 + CO) using renewable energy. Internal reforming SOFCs can generate power using carbon-neutral methanol and dimethyl ether, which are synthesized from the syngas.
